agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Environmental Regulation TIME & DATE: 10:30 AM or upon final adjourn./recess or bill referral if permission granted Wednesday, April 17, 2019 PLACE: E1.026 CHAIR: Rep. J. M. Lozano The order in which bills are heard is at the discretion of the chair. The committee will meet to hear public testimony on the following: HB 999 Collier Relating to who may request a public hearing from the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality related to the construction of a concrete plant. HB 907 Huberty Relating to the penalty for failure to register certain aggregate production operations with the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality. HB 3816 Morrison Relating to the regulatory analysis of rules proposed by the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality. HB 3930 Morrison Relating to a prohibition of the land application of grease or grit trap waste. HB 4568 Cyrier Relating to the consideration of floodplain maps in the permitting of certain solid waste facilities. HB 1310 Dutton Relating to who may request a public hearing from the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality related to the construction of a concrete plant. HB 798 Walle Relating to plot plan requirements for an application for a standard permit for a concrete batch plant issued by the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality. HB 4344 Stephenson Relating to municipal solid waste management services contracts; limiting the amount of a fee. HB 4584 Hefner Relating to sale of returnable containers; creating a criminal offense. HB 3798 Biedermann Relating to the regulation of and permit requirements for certain facilities that extract, produce, or process aggregates and of related facilities by the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality and the Railroad Commission of Texas; providing administrative penalties and other civil remedies; creating criminal offenses. HB 3318 Burns Relating to a permit requirement for the land application of domestic septage. HB 3319 Burns Relating to the collection of soil monitoring samples from land application units where sewage sludge or domestic septage is applied. HB 4600 Wilson Relating to requirements for certain air quality permit applications for aggregate productions located in the jurisdiction of a municipality. Notice of this meeting was announced from the house floor. Bills added after last posting: HB 4600 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
